title: Induced current - square wire dropped into B-field

content.question: Two square wire loops are held so that the bottom side of the loop is a vertical height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> above a uniform magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> that is directed out of the page. Loop <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has sides of length <math alttext="l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>ℓ</mo></math> and Loop <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has sides of length <math alttext="one half l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>ℓ</mo></mstyle></math>. The top side of both loops is made of the same uniform resistive material, as shown. The loops are released and fall downward. At the instant loops <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> enter the magnetic field, the magnetic force exerted on each loop is <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. What is <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 2 equals the fraction F sub 1, end sub, over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2 equals the fraction F sub 1, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="F sub 2 equals F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="F sub 2 equals 2 F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 2 equals the fraction F sub 1, end sub, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
